messages.message: There's no solo in sight right now
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'There's no solo in sight right now'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. France's assessment that there is no immediate solo victory on the horizon indicates a nuanced understanding of the current board dynamics and the balance of power among the players, reflecting a realistic and strategic approach to evaluating the game situation accurately.

messages.message: Probably makes sense to build an army for you I would think. We're stalemated in the Mediterranean anyway
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Probably makes sense to build an army for you I would think. We're stalemated in the Mediterranean anyway'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. France's suggestion for you to build an army, considering the stalemate in the Mediterranean, demonstrates a pragmatic approach to enhancing your defensive capabilities and potentially preparing for strategic moves in other areas of the board where there may be more room for growth or influence.

messages.message: I'm building an army in Marseilles for example
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'I'm building an army in Marseilles for example'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. France's decision to build an army in Marseilles indicates a reinforcement of their military strength in a key location, potentially signaling intentions to secure their position, defend against potential threats, or position themselves strategically for future moves on the board.

messages.message: What do you mean there's no solo in sight? lol you're on 15 and there are three free centres in England... I might not be paying much attention to this game but I'd have to be blind and dumb not to see that. Even if there weren't freebies there you could get them elsewhere. You'd have to try harder not to solo from here haha
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'What do you mean there's no solo in sight? lol you're on 15 and there are three free centres in England... I might not be paying much attention to this game but I'd have to be blind and dumb not to see that. Even if there weren't freebies there you could get them elsewhere. You'd have to try harder not to solo from here haha'.

messages.message: Sure, it's definitely possible. That being said, I also think it would be inconvenient to take English supply Centers due to the density of those units
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Sure, it's definitely possible. That being said, I also think it would be inconvenient to take English supply Centers due to the density of those units'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. France's acknowledgment of the possibility of a solo victory and the consideration of the strategic challenges in taking English supply centers due to unit density indicates a thoughtful assessment of the potential paths to victory and the practical difficulties that may arise in executing certain strategic moves, reflecting a balanced and strategic mindset in evaluating the game situation.

messages.message: Regarding the three way, the best way to do it would probably be to force Austria off the map this turn. Maybe Bulgaria-Serbia with support from Rumania while Russia supports Galicia to Budapest?
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Regarding the three way, the best way to do it would probably be to force Austria off the map this turn. Maybe Bulgaria-Serbia with support from Rumania while Russia supports Galicia to Budapest?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. France's strategic suggestion to force Austria off the map by coordinating moves like Bulgaria to Serbia with support from Rumania while Russia supports Galicia to Budapest highlights a clear plan for reshaping the alliances and board dynamics towards the proposed three-way draw, indicating a focused and collaborative approach to securing the desired outcome in the game.

messages.message: The only issue would be a retreat to Greece or Albania, so it might be worthwhile to bounce in Albania with Greece and Ion to prevent any retreats
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'The only issue would be a retreat to Greece or Albania, so it might be worthwhile to bounce in Albania with Greece and Ion to prevent any retreats'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. France's consideration of potential retreat options for Austria and the suggestion to bounce in Albania with Greece and Ion to block any retreats demonstrates a strategic understanding of the possible outcomes and the proactive approach in preventing unwanted movements that could disrupt the planned progression towards achieving the desired three-way draw.

messages.message: Interesting, I didn't mean to take Naples- I figured you might cut the Tyrhenian Sea's support. I'll move out if we can call a truce in Trieste?
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Interesting, I didn't mean to take Naples- I figured you might cut the Tyrhenian Sea's support. I'll move out if we can call a truce in Trieste?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. France's willingness to move out of Naples and propose a truce in Trieste, following a potential misunderstanding about the support in the Tyrhenian Sea, indicates a diplomatic approach focused on resolving conflicts and maintaining collaborative relationships, suggesting a commitment to finding mutually beneficial solutions in the game.

messages.message: Interesting choice to move to Albania as it means that Turkey can retreat to Greece
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Interesting choice to move to Albania as it means that Turkey can retreat to Greece'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. France's observation about the potential retreat option for Turkey to Greece due to the move to Albania shows an astute awareness of the tactical implications of the moves on the board, indicating a strategic understanding of the possible outcomes and the need to carefully consider the next steps to prevent any unwanted developments for their position.

messages.message: *Austria can retreat to Greece
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'*Austria can retreat to Greece'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. France's correction that Austria, not Turkey, can retreat to Greece highlights the importance of accurate unit retreat possibilities in Diplomacy and reflects a sharp eye for detail in evaluating and communicating strategic outcomes on the board.

messages.message: This game is over, spending more than 2 minutes per season is a waste of time. I'm glad you found the moves interesting though! I cant stop laughing at "I didn't mean to take Naples". In my experience, the best way not to take something is to not attack it. That's just what I've found but I guess you've got other methods of not taking something haha, of course you meant to take Naples and of course we both know that this game has been over for a few seasons. It's all the same at this point. Good game, well played. If you're trying to rack up lies with me I wouldn't bother. I have to conclude that that's the only point for all of them the last few seasons or is it just for fun? If its just for fun, carry on, I dont mind. If its for the successful lie counter, Russia is a better option for that I think?
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'This game is over, spending more than 2 minutes per season is a waste of time. I'm glad you found the moves interesting though! I cant stop laughing at "I didn't mean to take Naples". In my experience, the best way not to take something is to not attack it. That's just what I've found but I guess you've got other methods of not taking something haha, of course you meant to take Naples and of course we both know that this game has been over for a few seasons. It's all the same at this point. Good game, well played. If you're trying to rack up lies with me I wouldn't bother. I have to conclude that that's the only point for all of them the last few seasons or is it just for fun? If its just for fun, carry on, I dont mind. If its for the successful lie counter, Russia is a better option for that I think?'.

messages.message: Well. I was trying to get you to not take Trieste in the fall. I can support it to hold, but I suspect that if you and Russia are coordinating, Vienna would cut Tyrolia's support.
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Well. I was trying to get you to not take Trieste in the fall. I can support it to hold, but I suspect that if you and Russia are coordinating, Vienna would cut Tyrolia's support.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. France's explanation of attempting to prevent the capture of Trieste in the fall phase and the strategic considerations involved, such as the potential support cut in Tyrolia by Vienna, displays a continued engagement with diplomatic nuances and a commitment to navigating complex interactions in the game, emphasizing the tactical depth and foresight involved in diplomatic maneuvers.
